meanings.definition: A musical note with a time value equal to half a minim in common time.
meanings.sent1: In the song, the crotchets were played softly by the pianist.
meanings.sent2: The music teacher explained that crotchets are worth half a minim.
meanings.sent3: The crotchets in the melody seemed to dance together in harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like a cascade of crotchets in the air.
meanings.sent5: The crotchets in the tune were like little heartbeats, keeping the rhythm alive.

meanings.definition: A small hook or hook-shaped mark used in writing or printing to indicate a pause or to separate sections.
meanings.sent1: The document had crotchets at the end of each paragraph.
meanings.sent2: She used crotchets to mark the important points in her essay.
meanings.sent3: The crotchets on the page seemed to wink mischievously at the reader.
meanings.sent4: His words were like crotchets, guiding the reader through the text.
meanings.sent5: The crotchets acted as tiny signposts, directing attention to key information.
